comments.body:
`coverage` should be added to the `ci` alias.  That's the whole point of the `ci` alias.

Also there's no particular point to using `;` here.  Just use spaces.  like so:

```bash
sbt -Dsbt.profile=coverage ++$TRAVIS_SCALA_VERSION ci
```

The idea with `-Dsbt.profile=coverage` is to enable the plugin on demand, because that plugin is not well grown and have had problems with it when it is always enabled.

If we add it to the `ci` command, we'll have to do it in a way that works with `-Dsbt.profile=coverage`.

Yeah there's no way to add the property invocation to the `ci` alias, which is part of why I'm ok with this build script existing.  But if we're just going to invoke `coverage` every time we invoke `ci` (see below!), then there's no reason not to.

**Edit:** Just saw your reply.  Makes sense.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +20,24 @@    echo "Executing build (with coverage):"
    echo
    sbt -Dsbt.profile=coverage ";++$TRAVIS_SCALA_VERSION;coverage;ci"
else
    echo

comments.body: Why is the `sbt` invocation inside the `if` if it's just the same invocation in both places?  As a sidebar, I'm pretty sure this means that coverage is *always* running.
It's a mistake. Will fix it. The idea is to not run coverage all the time.
